results.title: The Big red barn
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward, John Churchill and Robert Ennis
results.brief_description: Describes the daily life and activities of the domesticated animals of a farm that live together in the big red barn. Encourages creativity in oral and written expression, as the film is narrated in rhyming verse. Based on the story by Margaret Wise Brown. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward, John Churchill and Robert Ennis

results.title: The Big picture: conservation treatment of a large painting
results.creator_credit: Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre, Department of Home Affairs and Ian Hart
results.brief_description: Conservators, Allan Byrne and Tom Dixon, discuss the restoration of the huge oil paint by Tom Roberts entitled “The Opening of the First Parliament of the Australian Commonwealth by His Majesty King George V (when Duke of York). 9th May 1901”. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: The Big muster
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, A M P Society and Ben Burgandy
results.brief_description: Shows the rural holdings of the Australian Mutual Provident Society, and its contribution to the cattle industry in Australia. This is a record of the contribution the A.M.P. Society and its policyholders are making to the Australian beef industry. Shows pasture improvement on established properties, development of new pastures and marketing.

results.title: The Big mill
results.creator_credit: Jack Holmes, Templar Film Studios and Laurence Henson
results.brief_description: The Big Mill is a steel strip mill at Motherwell, outside Glasgow. The film follows the processes of making, testing and rolling hot steel slabs and sheeting, destined for use in every branch of modern life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Holmes, Templar Film Studios and Laurence Henson

results.title: The Big island [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Big if
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, United Nations, Kamil Pixa, Peter Hollander and Brent Walker Film Productions
results.brief_description: An animated satire questioning what our money might be able to be used for if it was not spent on defence weapons. Animated by Boris Masnik.

results.title: The Big gull: Karoro: New Zealand's black-backed gull
results.creator_credit: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Grant Foster
results.brief_description: The New Zealand black-backed gull is one of 44 species that has adapted its natural way of life, to benefit from the wasteful habits of man. With naturalist Sir Robert Falla.
